1.name: Paul Bakaus
1.title: Googler, AMP expert
1.shortBio: Paul is a Web Developer Advocate at Google, and spends most of his time making the web fast and user friendly, currently by supporting the Accelerated Mobile Pages project.
1.bio: Paul worked at Zynga before Google and his widest known creations are jQuery UI and Aves Engine. Currently he is workign on the Accelerated Mobile Pages project.

2.name: Nilay Yener
2.title: Program Manager for Google Developer Relations
2.shortBio: Nilay helps a lot for GDGs in North America and all around the world.

3.name: Laura Krake
3.title: Illustrator and Graphic Designer
3.shortBio: Graphic Designer and Illustrator determined to enhance UI/UX.
3.bio: Laura graduated from the University of St. Thomas, MN with a B.A. in Spanish Linguists and a B.A. in Psychology. She applies her knowledge of human behavior and culture to technically architect everything from complex illustrations to minimalist vectors. Her favorite pastimes include painting digitally, playing Ultimate Frisbee, and ballroom dancing.

4.name: Sandeep Dinesh
4.title: Developer Advocate
4.shortBio: Sandeep is a Developer Advocate at Google, currently focused on helping developers with Google Cloud...
4.bio: Sandeep started coding and creating websites when he was 12 and hasn't stopped. He is passionate about building easy-to-use products people love. Before Google, he founded an IoT startup in agriculture and developed educational HTML5 games. At Google, Sandeep's goal is to make cloud easy and help developers create the next big thing. Sandeep loves video games, making music, and martial arts, and has Bachelors in Marketing and Computer Science.

5.name: Martin Omander
5.title: Program Manager for Google Developer Relations
5.shortBio: Martin helps a lot for GDGs in North America and all around the world. He is a great coder and father too.

6.name: Murat Yener
6.title: Android GDE, Android Geek, GDG Istambul co-organizer
6.shortBio: A code geek, open source committer, conference speaker and Android Software Developer at Intel.
6.bio: Experienced in developing Mobile (native/html5), Java, Web, Flex, GWT, JavaEE and OSGi applications besides teaching courses and mentoring. Eclipse committer in Eclipse Libra project. GDG Istanbul organizer since 2009 and a Conference Speaker.

badges.name: Java Champion
badges.description: Highest Honor in the Java Developer Realm

7.name: Justin Ribeiro
7.title: GDE and GDG Mentor in North America Pacific Region
7.shortBio: Build and hack on just about anything
7.bio: Co-organizer of the GDG Oakdale, a GDE, Oakdale OpenMesh, and his three daughters. 18+ years development experience and author of the upcoming book 'Developing a Google Glass Edge', he is constantly building software, sensors, and hacking on toys.

8.name: James Duvall IV
8.title: Software Engineer, Speaker, GDG co-organizer
8.shortBio: Software Engineer, speaker, GDG Oakdale and Oakdale OpenMesh organizer
8.bio: A software engineer and co-organizer of the GDG Oakdale, Oakdale OpenMesh and his three daughters. With 10+ years of development experience, he works daily in .Net technologies, C#, and Chrome, building web applications that push the web to its limits.

9.name: Walter Kuppens
9.title: Software Engineer experienced in cloud technologies.
9.shortBio: Passionate Software developer, wants to know why things work.
9.bio: Walter is a software developer with an interest in web development and some more esoteric things like emulator development. He has worked with many technology stacks such as Go, Python, Rust, AWS, and GCP to build scalable applications for the modern web.

10.name: Paul Perrone
10.title: Software Enginner and graduate student
10.shortBio: Data Analyst Enraptured with Machine Learning, Literature, and Video Games
10.bio: Paul is a graduate of Claremont McKenna College with a bachelor's degree in Economics. He has worked with numerous APIs including the Riot Games API, the Twitter API, the Twitch API, and numerous Google Analytics stacks. Paul enjoys spending his free time studying Machine Learning, Literature, and Video Games.

11.name: Csaba Toth
11.title: Universal software engineer (can tackle any problem), Speaker, User Group junkie
11.company: WestShore Technologies Inc., Csaba Technology Services, LLC
11.shortBio: All-round software engineer (can tackle any problem), speaker, organizer
11.bio: Full stack developer in Fresno and a user group junkie. He was C/C++ CAD software developer in the past and actively worked and working with .NET, Java and Python technology stacks including JS/HTML5/CSS front end (besides many).

12.name: Derek Payton
12.title: Software Developer and CTO
12.shortBio: Derek is a software developer, Open Source contributor, community organizer, and shameless Python fanboy.
12.bio: Derek built his first web page when he was 11 years old. The web has come a long way since 1998, and so has he. He first picked up Python in 2007 and hasn‚Äôt put it down since. He‚Äôs built dozens of websites and applications with Django, including sites for companies like DC Shoes, Sony, and Alpinestars. He‚Äôs built exactly one Android app before and would love to build more, except for that whole Java thing. He‚Äôs currently a Software Developer and CTO at Edit, LLC in Fresno, and organizes Fresno Python and Fresno Hack Night.

13.name: Todd McLeod
13.title: CIT Profesor, Speaker, Go advocate
13.company: Fresno City College, California State University Fresno
13.bio: Todd McLeod is tenured faculty at Fresno City College and also work at California State University Fresno. Recent areas of focus include Go, Python, Java, Android, and Git.

14.name: Rio Waller
14.title: Educator, GDG leader and motivational speaker
